2. Configuration¶

Most of DATAGERRY’s configuration is stored in MongoDB. However, a few parameters, such as the database connection to MongoDB itself, cannot be stored there. For these parameters, we provide an INI-style configuration file called cmdb.conf. Please see the following example:

[Database]
host = 127.0.0.1
port = 27017
database_name = cmdb
;username = username
;password = password

[WebServer]
host = 0.0.0.0
port = 4000

[MessageQueueing]
host = 127.0.0.1
port = 5672
username = guest
password = guest
exchange = datagerry.eventbus
connection_attempts = 2
retry_delay = 6
use_tls = False

It is possible to overwride settings in the configuration file with OS environment variables. Please see the following example:

DATAGERRY_<section_name>_<option_name>
DATAGERRY_Database_port=27018

This feature is especially useful, if you want to run DATAGERRY in Docker.
